name: Meru
headline: Voice to Flowsheet for Nurses.
description: Nurses can spend 40% of their shift doing documentation. We double a nurse's productivity, and reduce documentation burden with a voice  flowsheet interface.

founders.name: Rohan Arora, Founder
founders.description: CEO, Meru. Previously worked at JHU APL on MLOps and modeling for the Covid-19 National Health Mission & built technology to track animal mice. Studied Bioengineering at Berkeley.

founders.name: Venkat Krishnan, Founder
founders.description: CTO, Meru. Prev worked at Tesla Autopilot AI. Studied Computer Engineering at UCSB, where I researched adversarial robustness and hardware acceleration of transformer models.

raw_markdown='# Meru is now available in Epic Rover. Contact Us to Learn More 
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/65d7be391272398ae9c658ab_Group%20435-2.svg)](https://usemeru.com/<#>)[Home](https://usemeru.com/</>)[Product](https://usemeru.com/</product>)[Impact](https://usemeru.com/</impact>)[Team](https://usemeru.com/</team>)[Careers](https://usemeru.com/<https:/www.ycombinator.com/companies/meru/jobs>)[Podcast](https://usemeru.com/</podcast>)
Contact Us
# Clinical Quality Copilot for Nursing Workflows
Read.
# Knowledge Acquisition
Synthesize responses based on information from internal policies and patient data. 
[See the Impact](https://usemeru.com/</impact>)
Write.
# Patient Documentation
Ensure complete and accurate flowsheet documentation that is compliant with internal rules.
[Explore the Platform](https://usemeru.com/</product>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/66da4c89e1ca90cace599119_Untitled_design__2_-removebg-preview.png)
### Say Hello to Florence, the AI Nurse Assistant
Florence adds a layer of artificial intelligence to every knowledge retrieval or patient documentation related task, helping reduce incomplete, noncompliant care and improve quality outcomes.
Tabbed Workflow Layout
Knowledge Acquisition Patient Documentation
1
Ask Question
The nurse can ask a question about care procedures in natural language, using the necessary clinical terminology. 
2
Synthesize Answer
Florence will review the question to form an answer based on organizational policies, clinical guidelines, available supplies, and the patient's records. Florence may ask follow-up questions from the nurse if additional information is needed. 
3
Review Evidence
Florence will respond to the nurse's question with an evidence-based response. The nurse can review the specific sources used to generate this response and ask follow-up questions. 
1
Listen and Observe
Nurse can speak about a patient, speak with a patient, or submit images to describe a patient’s condition. Florence will parse through this information, taking into account the medical slang, language barriers, accents, lighting conditions, and the presence of multiple parties. 
2
Guide
Florence will attempt to complete patient flowsheet documentation based on the provided information. If key information is missing, Florence will prompt the nurse to provide it to ensure that Florence generates documentation that is complete and compliant. 
3
Review
Florence will present the documentation to the nurse for final review. Once the documentation is reviewed, it can be submitted directly to the EHR. 
[Learn More](https://usemeru.com/</product>)
### Meru is available directly in your EHR, and is HIPPA and SOC 2 Compliant
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/65d7ec4c6ce1366f3a10693e_cerner.svg)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/65d7ebb841664fb8c886ccf5_Epic-logo-transparent-e1659637275781.webp)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/66de32b3d8240ad070f5b45e_Athenahealth-Logo.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/66de33cca3763daba5df5037_meditech-logo%20\(1\).svg)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/67728aae7b1eefa28a1f86d0_hipaa-compliant-seeklogo.png)![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/677289e31b68d708238950ae_aicpa-soc-logo-freelogovectors.net_-PNG-2.png)
### Brought to You By Nurses Everywhere. 
Meru has been built by working closely with nurses from institutions all over the country, including places like the University of Kansas Health System, Children's Hospital of Atlanta, and Columbia University. Nurses have helped us label hundreds of thousands of data points to ensure only the highest quality accuracy. 
> "I am so excited, I cannot adequately describe how excited I am about the possibility of ambient AI and improving nursing documentation burden. Essentially, what you guys are working on could potentially almost completely eliminate the time that a nurse spends in documentation. And what that means — what we know — is that the time that a nurse spends in documentation is inversely proportional to the time that the nurse has available for patient care… So the AI tools, I really feel like — and working with you all — the sky is the limit for this."- Clinical Care Nurse Specialist 
[Hear the Podcast →](https://usemeru.com/<http:/usemeru.com/podcast>)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/66de6fd2a3763daba513dc33_office%20picture.avif)
Join Us
## Nurses, engineers, and nurse engineers. 
We're hiring nurses, engineers, and everyone in between to help build and scale Meru. Your most important job at Meru will be to listen to and observe nurses in action on the hospital floor. If this sounds interesting, please reach out. We work in person out of our office in San Francisco, CA.If you are a nurse, you can join our data labeling team part-time, and contribute your expertise to our suite of artificial intelligence models.
[Join the Team](https://usemeru.com/<https:/www.ycombinator.com/companies/meru/jobs>)Contribute Your Nursing Knowledge
[![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65d7be391272398ae9c65845/65d7be391272398ae9c658ac_Group%20437.svg)](https://usemeru.com/</>)
© 2025 Meru Productions Inc, All rights reserved.
[Email: rohan [at] usemeru.comPhone: (510)-894-5410](https://usemeru.com/</contact>)
Meru is founded in San Francisco. We're backed by Ycombinator and Cadenza Ventures.

generated_description:
**Meru: Revolutionizing Nursing Documentation**

Founded in 2023 and hailing from San Francisco, Meru aims to tackle a significant pain point in healthcare: the cumbersome documentation responsibilities of nurses. Studies show that nurses can spend up to 40% of their shift on paperwork; Meru is here to change that. Their mission? To turn voice input into comprehensive flowsheets, effectively doubling nursing productivity and minimizing documentation burdens.

Meru has quickly made its mark, becoming part of Y Combinator's Winter 2023 batch and building a dedicated team of 15. With Aaron Epstein as a group partner, they’re stepping into the healthcare tech landscape with a solid foundation.

### What Does Meru Offer?

At its core, Meru has developed Florence, an AI Nurse Assistant that transforms how nurses handle patient data and documentation. Florence helps in two main areas:

1. **Knowledge Acquisition**: Nurses can ask questions in natural language related to care procedures. Florence synthesizes responses using internal policies, patient data, and clinical guidelines.

2. **Patient Documentation**: By listening to nurses or processing images, Florence captures vital patient information and assists in creating compliant, accurate documentation for Electronic Health Records (EHRs).

This tool isn’t just a productivity hack; it’s about quality care. As nurses spend less time on documentation, they can dedicate more time to patient care—a major win for both healthcare professionals and patients.

### Collaboration and Compliance

Meru collaborates closely with healthcare institutions, including the University of Kansas Health System and Children’s Hospital of Atlanta, ensuring their tools are built on real-world needs. And they're not just innovative; Meru is HIPAA and SOC 2 compliant, which is crucial in the healthcare industry.

### The Future of Nursing

Meru is inviting nurses, engineers, and tech enthusiasts to join their mission to build and scale this innovative healthcare tool. Their call to action is clear: if you want to make a real impact on nursing workflows, join them in San Francisco or contribute remotely as part of their data labeling team.

In summary, Meru is not just about efficiency; it’s about empowering nurses, improving patient care, and setting a new standard in healthcare documentation. If you’re interested in learning more or exploring potential career opportunities, check out their website at [usemeru.com](https://usemeru.com). 

The future is looking bright for nursing documentation, and with Meru at the helm, it could genuinely transform how care is delivered.
